error.signature: Error: Version 19.x not found. Available versions: 18.x, 20.x, 22.x
error.regex: (?:Version \d+\.x not found|Unable to find version|Node\.js version .* is not available|Could not find Node\.js version)

verdict.summary: The actions/setup-node step cannot find the requested Node.js version. Occurs when specifying EOL versions, odd-numbered versions, or versions not yet available on the runner.

dead_ends.action: Pin to a very specific patch version like 18.17.1 without checking availability
dead_ends.why_fails: Specific patch versions may not be available on GitHub-hosted runners; the version manifest is updated independently

dead_ends.action: Manually install Node.js from source in a run step
dead_ends.why_fails: Compiling from source is extremely slow, fragile in CI, and conflicts with the runner's pre-installed tools

workarounds.action: Use an LTS version specifier or .nvmrc file with setup-node
workarounds.how: Set 'node-version: 20' or 'node-version: lts/*' in actions/setup-node, or create a .nvmrc file and use 'node-version-file: .nvmrc'

workarounds.action: Check available versions and use a supported major version
workarounds.how: Use only even-numbered LTS versions (18, 20, 22). Check https://github.com/actions/node-versions/releases for available versions on GitHub runners

leads_to.condition: When switching Node version causes lockfile compatibility issues

preceded_by.condition: When the node-version value is not quoted and YAML interprets it incorrectly

frequently_confused_with.distinction: Node version mismatch is about the runtime not being available; npm ci failed is about package installation issues with an already-installed Node
